page.title: 08HOUSING_OLD AND NEW
page.content: Pipewell cottage is owned by an hospitable lady. Her house in Thurlaston is attractive and was built about 600 years ago. It was originally three cottages. The house was named after monks from Northampshire who apparenly had a well nearby. It was made in cruck construction with wattle and daub. It became the gardeners cottage to the local manor.Seven evacuees hid there in world war ll living in the room at the end of the house. Near the bridge entering the village there once was an 8ft common churchway between Thurlaston and Dunchurch for the bearers at funerals, there being no church yard at Thurlaston. In the last ten years this has been covered by new detached homes called the Gardens.
